meanings.definition: A person or thing that impedes or obstructs progress.
meanings.sent1: The slow traffic was an impeder to our journey.
meanings.sent2: The fallen tree acted as an impeder on the path.
meanings.sent3: The impeder in the form of a closed road made us take a detour.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was an invisible impeder holding her back.
meanings.sent5: The impeder, like a giant boulder, blocked our way forward.

meanings.definition: To hinder or obstruct the progress of something.
meanings.sent1: Please do not impeder the flow of traffic by parking in the middle of the road.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain impedered our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent3: His habit of procrastination tends to impeder his academic success.
meanings.sent4: The lack of resources impedered the completion of the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog impedered visibility on the road, causing delays.
